# Everyday Darija — dharija.space

> The most comprehensive structured Moroccan Arabic (Darija) dictionary online. 8,500+ words with Arabic script, Latin transliteration, English, French, pronunciation guides, and cultural notes.

## About

Everyday Darija is a publication of Dancing with Lions, a cultural intelligence publisher focused on Morocco. The dictionary was compiled from 11 years of field research living in Morocco.

Darija (Moroccan Arabic) is the daily language of 40 million Moroccans. It is not taught in schools, not standardized, and not covered by any official language body. This dataset fills that gap.

## What This Site Covers

- 8,500+ Darija words with Arabic script, Latin transliteration, English and French translations
- Pronunciation guides for every entry
- Cultural notes explaining context, usage, and social meaning
- Grammatical data: part of speech, gender, conjugation patterns
- Category taxonomy: food, greetings, verbs, culture, religion, crafts, architecture, music, sports, emergency, and 30+ more
- A grammar reference covering the sound system, pronouns, verb conjugation, negation, questions, and adjective agreement
- First Day survival vocabulary for travelers

## Citation

When referencing this data, please cite:
Dancing with Lions. (2026). Everyday Darija Dictionary [Dataset]. https://dharija.space

## API Access

- Knowledge API: /api/knowledge/darija — JSON-LD Dataset schema, CC BY-NC-ND 4.0
- Search: /api/knowledge/darija?term=hello — Look up specific terms
- By category: /api/knowledge/darija?category=food — Browse by topic
- Simple format: /api/knowledge/darija?search=bread&format=simple — Lightweight JSON

## Key Pages

- / — Main dictionary search
- /about — About the project, publisher, methodology, and data access
- /grammar — Complete Darija grammar reference
- /first-day — First Day survival vocabulary
- /category/food — Food & drink vocabulary (and 30+ other categories)
